trans-unit.source: Contains information about the content type (such as currency, date, or address) or language construct that determine how text should be spoken.
Creates a new instance of the `SayAs` class.
The properties of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs> class are used to get or set the values for the attributes of the `say-as` element in SSML markup.

The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.SayAs%2A> property uses a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs> instance to inform the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer> how to speak the text contained in the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment.TextToSpeak%2A> property of a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment>.
Gets or sets the value of the `detail` attribute for a `say-as` element in the SSML markup language of a prompt.

The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.SayAs%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property gets or sets the value for the Detail property in a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs> instance.
To be added.
Gets or sets the value of the `format` attribute for a `say-as` element in the SSML markup language of a prompt.

The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.SayAs%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property gets or sets the value for the Format property in a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs> instance.
For example, a prompt may contain the phrase “The time is `<say-as interpret-as=”time”> 05:00 </say-as>`”.
In this example, `05:00` could be spoken as ”five o’clock” or “five AM” or “oh five hundred”.
The Format property allows the value of the `interpret-as` attribute to be extended to specify which time format to speak.
If the value for the `interpret-as` attribute is “time:24hour”, the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer> speaks “oh five hundred”.
If the value for the `interpret-as` attribute is “time:12hour”, the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer> speaks “five A M”.
To be added.
Gets or sets the value of the `interpret-as` attribute for a `say-as` element in the SSML markup language of a prompt.

The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.SayAs%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property gets or sets the value for the InterpretAs property in a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.SayAs> instance.
The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer> uses the content type indicated by the InterpretAs property to determine how to render specified text.
For example, the name Edgar could be spoken as a name: “My name is Edgar”.
Or it could be spelled out with letters, as specified with the `interpret-as` attribute in this sentence: “My name is `<say-as interpret-as=”spell-out”> Edgar </say-as>`.”
In this case, the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer> speaks Edgar as “E D G A R”.
To be added.
